lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kulw bDU gur jn mY GUGt pt ishjw sMjog smY AMqru n pIA sY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kulaa Badhoo Gur Jan Mai Ghooghat Pata , Sihajaa Sanjog Samai Antaru N Peea Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a daughter-in-law covers herself with veil in front of the elders of the house, but keeps no distance from her husband at the time of sharing his bed;

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy mix ACq kutMb hI sihq Aih bMk qn sUDo ibl pYsq huie jIA sY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Mani Achhat Koutanb Hee Sahit Ahi , Bank Tan Soodho Bil Paisat Hui Jeea Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a snake remains crooked when with female snake and his family, but becomes straight when it enters in the burrow;

lines.gurmukhi: mwqw ipqw ACq n bolY suq binqw sY pwCy kY dY srbsu moh suq qIA sY
lines.transliteration_english: Maataa Pitaa Achhat N Bolai Sout Banitaa Sai , Paachhay Kai Dai Sarabasu Moh Sout Teea Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a son avoids talking to his wife in front of his parents, but when alone showers all his love upon her,

lines.gurmukhi: logn mY logwcwr gurmuiK eykMkwr sbd suriq aunmn mn hIA sY ]41]
lines.transliteration_english: Logan Mai Logaachaar Gurmukhi Aykankaara , Sabad Surati Ounaman Man Heea Sai ?41?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly a devoted Sikh appears worldly among others but having attached his mind with Guru's word, he rises spiritually and realises the Lord. Quintessence: One may maintain oneself as a worldly person outwardly but inwardly one keeps oneself attached w
